Then there is no reason to avoid using reflection, where  
appropriate.  To not do so would be like a carpenter refusing to use  
a saw because he *might* hurt himself.  There are scenarios, though I  
would agree they are not common in many contexts, where using  
reflection is the cleanest, most elegant, solution.
